intro: Paubrasilia echinata, commonly known as the pink poinsettia, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking, colorful bracts that resemble petals. The plant produces small, inconspicuous yellow flowers surrounded by vibrant red or pink foliage. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant. Its unique appearance and seasonal color changes make it a popular choice for festive decorations.
